definition: to blow/to play a wind instrument/to blast/to puff/to boast/to brag/to end in failure/to fall through

sentences.english: Exporting TV dramas is just one way for Koreans to shamelessly promote themselves.
sentences.chinese: 出口韓劇也是韓國人無恥自我吹噓的一個途徑。

sentences.english: Stop blowing your own horn before me. I know you very well.
sentences.chinese: 別在我面前自我吹噓，我非常瞭解你。

sentences.english: Don't blow your own horn. If you do something praiseworthy, someone will eventually notice.
sentences.chinese: 別自我吹噓，你所做的有價值的事，別人終會知道。

sentences.english: With all hisboasting, Jack achieved very little.
sentences.chinese: 傑克雖然很能自我吹噓，但成就不大。

sentences.english: He likes blowing his own trumpet.
People usually don't trust those who always advertise themselves.
sentences.chinese: 人們往往不太信任那些喜歡自我吹噓的人。
